Name: Gma
Title: Zoo ... just a zoo....
Review: This is not a national park if the nation can not enjoy it.  It is just a zoo. All the res of the gorgeous area is saved for the governor's family.... sham!!

Name: Bhaskar
Title: Zoo, not a national park
Review: Firstly, it's not a national park. It is a children's park, more like a Zoo, where there are a few animals like deer, Blackbuck, jackal etc. and reptiles like lizards, crocodiles, alligators with a few birds. Not a place where one can spend more than an hour. There is also a snake park adjacent to it which is better. Ticket for adults is Rs. 20 and for children above 5 years upto 12 years is Rs. 15.

Name: Jayesh Chandra ... P
Title: Small Zoo
Review: There is a Snake park and a Children's Zoo + Park.. Both have different gates.  And different tickets.  Be careful when you buy tickets. The Zoo + Park does not have too many animals, but is well maintained.  I could not see too many animals.  Even the children's playground was crowded. There is a restaurant cum sit out outside the park. Not inside.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Good Place
Review: A good place to come and spend some time with friends and family in the sun. It is a bit difficult to get entry to see the various animals and the entire complex is a bit untidy. However, the exhibits are nice to see for both adults and kids.

Name: Michael A
Title: A little-known, boutique Nation Park: but impossible to enter due to the Game Warden's reluctance to allow visitors!
Review: I was bitterly disappointed to be unable to see and photograph the Blackbuck, rare in South India, in the Guindy National Park.Some fortunate‚Äîand determined‚Äîvisitors manage to get permission to visit this little-known gem of a National Park! A wonderful experience for the Indian wildlife enthusiast to see and photograph the graceful Indian antelope, the Black Buck of classic Mughal paintings, is inexplicably denied by the apparent indolence of the Present Game Warden, who is impossible to contact by telephone, email or gain audience by the overseas visitor!Why are some of the best things for the keen wildlife photographer made so difficult in South India‚Äîin contrast to the facilities in North India for wildlife photography by overseas visitor?

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: ü¶ñ
Review: quit simple to enjoyable for kids as well as adults ... very close to Anna University and the Gandhi Mandappam... insight of the campus musium planatorium and vdo shows are there but you must be book the tickets for those, prerior based on time!

Name: Richard7
Title: Shabby animal exhibits
Review: The Children's Park is run-down and shabby. I was disappointed by the animal exhibits that are in ramshackle cages. There are a few Indian animals that might interest tourists. The main section of the National Park is locked up and I was unable to work out how to find someone to let me in.

Name: eeebvr
Title: Greenery to spend an hour
Review: We can visit this place and spend for an hour or two. It is like a mini zoo with caged animals. This place has good green cover. Snake park is located beside this.

Name: Daniel
Title: Place to come
Review: This is a nice and perfect place for leisure with friends and family members. Love to visit again.....

Name: Priyanka V
Title: very good place for localites with children
Review: this place has a small zoo...........few deers,jackals,peacock,turtles,snake,ostrich,langur etc........along with a child play areacrowded on weekendshas a substandard eatery outside.........better take packed food...good outing for children...........one time see for adults

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: wow
Review: This is one more place that is so famous among both the locals and the tourists who visit the city,and house all kinds of wild animals and birds including some rare species from around the world.

Name: Chintan m
Title: Very nice national park..
Review: Situated in the heart of the city, this national park has birds, animals and reptiles. It is surely one of the best places to visit in chennai

Name: ashokd2007
Title: Excellent Park
Review: This is a very good park maintained very well. Cost is also very less. Children will really enjoy the park. Snake park is also nearby, and hence we can see venom extraction. The animals are also well fed. The children's park is also maintained well. It is well connected by buses.

Name: Azeez K
Title: Must visit place in chennai.
Review: This is very old attraction in chennai, commonly knowns as children park or snake park..Its a avery little zoo, but proximity to guindy national park, makes this place to green, serene and calm.Relax and mediate.. Great place to spend valuable time.

Name: Thriyam
Title: Zoo in the city
Review: If you want to go to the zoo but don't want to travel out of the city, this is your best bet. With a wide range of animals, birds and reptiles, and a lot of children's play activities like swings, slides and the like, this attraction is truly the real deal. Since it is decently wooded, you can venture even in the day time, provided you have a hat and glasses. You can easily spend 3 hours here and joy know where the time went. A must do with young children. They'll throughly enjoy it.

Name: Rohit K
Title: Awesome Place
Review: Nice place for visiting. lots of animals found here. One of the best place in Chennai for visiting üëçüëå

Name: Traveleasy15
Title: Nothing significant, alike all Zoo, can be avoided
Review: Not well maintained, area is vast but unfortunately no signages to guide on which way to go and view, necessary amenities also not maintained and dissmal condition.

Name: reddi_traveller
Title: Nice place
Review: A very nice place for kids to spend some quality time with nature and transportation facility is also great. Share autos will be available from local railway station and buses are also available frequently.

Name: Janani P
Title: Guindy national park
Review: Very good place for kids and family, well spent time there,all animals and birds are well maintained.

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Well maintained park
Review: A really good national Park with lots of animals and birds. There is a children's play area. Lots of benches to sit and relax. Drinking water and toilets available. No plastic zone. Really well maintained. A small section showing snakes and another with few fish and turtles. Good place to bring children

Name: Gokulnath R
Title: Laid-back park in the city
Review: GNP offers little excitement to children with its exhibits of deer, snakes, ducks and few other common wildlife. Youngsters may find it boring, but it all depends on your preferences. Not really exciting for photographers. But, this is the best you could ask for from a park situation right in the heart of the city

Name: Bumblebee0108
Title: Nice place...loosing its sheen.
Review: The 4 stars is only to the nostalgic value that people growing up in the city have. Almost all children growing up in Chennai get their first taste of nature in this park. It's right in the middle of the city surrounded by greenery, right next to the lush green IIT Madras campus. There are some decent varieties of birds and animals...surely not as much as it used to be. The place is clean...It also has a jungle gym for kids where the equipments need some maintenance. The animals in the enclosure also need proper maintenance. There are very less or almost no carnivores...lots of deer...birds etc... Please authorities...wake up and save this place. Bring it back to life. Nevertheless, do visit with your kids...and visit the snake park next door. A good 2 hours can be spent here.

Name: Mohamed F
Title: Nice
Review: I went with my family and children we can see many animals really enjoy better than vandloor zoom good entertainment

Name: shrinikethv
Title: More like a children park with few animals and birds on display
Review: Don't expect this to be like a zoo. This is more of a children's park with just few animals and birds for display. Not well organized. Quality of food court inside the park is very poor. This can be a nice Sunday picnic spot for kids, apart from that nothing notable! Other advantage is that it is well within heart of city.

Name: Rajan I
Title: Very nice place for kids
Review: It's a very nice place to take kids for weekend.Several varieties of Snakes, Turtles & Crocodiles..Also birds, deers & monkeys in the park..Two separate Children play areas & they will love it.Better bring your own food if you want to spend whole day.You can avail food near the parking also.

Name: Shankar_Kamath
Title: Guindy National park
Review: A nice place for a family hangout with kids. There are lot of bird varities and deers inside. It also has children's play area. And a lot of trees and seatings. Overall a good place for a visit of 3 to 4 hours.

Name: Ram p
Title: Nice place (No elephants)
Review: Nice place to go as family in the heart of Chennai city. There is a good play area for children but needs little maintenance.There are no Elephants (photos in TripAdvisor are out dated).For Elephants/Tiger/Lion you need to visit Vandalur Zoo

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Beautiful Park
Review: I went to Guindy National Park. Guindy National Park consists of various vegetation zones mainly tropical dry evergreen flora with over 350 species of plants including trees, shrubs, climbers, herbs and grasses. It is great place to go.

Name: ManilaKwan
Title: Great park, beautiful walk, not easy to get entry to the park, except for the Children's Park area
Review: I persisted in asking the officials to allow me to walk in the park--the rewards were very many, beautiful fauna, spreading banyans, lots of deer.Children's Park area great for--well, yes, children.

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Small yet good park with wildlife
Review: Guindy National Park is an extraordinary place for environment lovers. This park has lot of birds and animals. Many people visit here as a family with kids who loves to see animals and birds. The place is green and well maintained.

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Nice park
Review: This park in a green part of Chennai is nice to take kids to, for an outing. Well located and very accessible by public transport.

Name: Josephsamuelot
Title: Park inside the city
Review: It is located beside the Adyar cancer institute and can be approached easily using public transport. Need to buy tickets separately for the park and the snake park. Totally a lovely place for kids to see and learn about birds and animals. Birds and butterflies make the park more attractive. Must visit place for the kids.

Name: Prabhakaran
Title: Best hangout for kids inside city
Review: I frequent this place with my kids. It has ample car park reasonable entry ticket minimal collection of animals. Elephant and cats missing. The park in nearly maintained and has a huge play area which keeps my kids engaged. We usually pack our food as the canteen is available only near car park. 2-3 hours can be spent with kids anytime better than the gaming zone or fun city in malls.

Name: priyanithin
Title: Can be better very few animals on display
Review: Can have more animals on display. Elephants would be a big draw. Like other species of Monkeys etc. Some reptile especially crocodile cages look overcrowded. A much better canteen is required they hardly have anything on offer. Since there are children visiting the can be animal feeding and more interactive sessions or explanations by zoo keepers

Name: jaga1997reddy
Title: Park of guindy
Review: This is an extraordinary place those who are nature lovers.this park consist of a wide variety species of birds and animals.this park also have a play ground which attracts the children more

Name: Karthik V
Title: Sunday visit with kid
Review: Guindy national park visit was the second one in recent times with my kid. Totally a lovely place in the heart of the city with animals which with kinds love to see and learn. Birds and butterflies make the park more attractive. When we went the peacocks there performed a lovely exqusitive dance to the amaze of the visitors. More than just animals and birds the kids have their ow play ground too with slides, see saw, swing and others. Kids enjoy the most here. Good place . Must vist for the kids to enjoy and learn.

Name: Rachamallu
Title: Guindy National park
Review: Guindy National park is an extraordinary place for environment lovers.The park has lot of birds and animals.The park also has children's playground in it.

Name: lekha m
Title: A bit of a letdown
Review: The guindy park as such is a nice place butThe one thing i was sad and shocked about was the snake park where small live chicks were left in cages along with snakes so that they can feed whenever hungry... it was too cruel to watch the little chicks all gathered in a corner trying to escape. I do understand the snakes need to be fed but this was just cruelty . I hope they change this arrangement.Other than this the park has a small childrens area where kids can have fun and some animal exhibits which are fine.

Name: velayudhan
Title: Childrens Park
Review: The Guindy National Park is one of the best amusements parks in Chennai .I had been there for spending time there with my cousins . There was a small entry fees there for the Park . Enjoyed the stay there . It was rally enjoayble

Name: Indyguy12
Title: A good national park/wildlife preserve right inside Chennai city
Review: Guindy Park hosts a small Zoo and a Snake Park. Both are excellent options for those with kids to spend an afternoon or morning watching and learning about nature, wildlife etc. Not to be missed if you love nature/wildlife as you can spend time here.

Name: Kalithasan R
Title: Good place to have in city limit
Review: Surprised to see the wonderful place with more tress sitting silently inside the concrete jungle. Kids adore this place. Snakes, lizard and deer are amazing to see. Our great grand father and my son was enjoying to the core. Good to see my GGF playing like a kid and was thrilled to be there like my two and half year old son.The parking and entry fees also not high. Good to go place for sure!!

Name: rajani k
Title: Small National Park within city limits
Review: This is a small national park within the city limits of Chennai Metropolitan.  Guindy National Park is the 8th smallest National Park of India. It's well connected by road through city buses and autos.  Apart from regular species of mammals and birds common in all national park, a rare collection seen here is of reptiles.  Several species of Lizards, Salamanders, Chameleons etc. could be seen.  Few food outlets are present inside the park.  Maintenance is kind of OK.

Name: bishnu s
Title: National Park within city limits
Review: Guindy National Park is a small national park in the centre of Chennai city. It's easily accessible by local train and buses from different parts of Chennai city. It's an ideal place for Chennaites to plan visit over a weekend.  You get to see a great variety of animals and plants here.  You get to see black bucks, spotted deer, jackals, monkeys, porcupines etc. and several species of birds can be spotted. If you are visiting in summer season do carry unbrella and lots of drinking water along with you.

Name: diptendubt
Title: A truly natural wonder
Review: Sitting at the heart of the city, this national park acts like the lung of Chennai metropoliton area. Encompassing IIT Madras, this place bordering Chennai city district on the way to the South suburb, a must visit area and an ideal place for higher education.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Small Park inside City limits
Review: Good learning place for kids to see bit of wildlife within city limits. not too many animals, but, still, kids enjoy a lot here and can get good fresh air here.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Closer to city
Review: Good place to take children to show wildlife. Lot of green trees, you cna get fresh air and oxygen. Maintenance is very low and needs proper fencing and landscaping to attract more tourists and locals. its a small zoo and not a big one.

Name: Rajesh k
Title: National Park within city limits
Review: Guindy national park is different from other National parks as it is a located with the centre of Chennai city. Ideally most National.parks in our country are located far away from cities and towns. Buses, autos and local train connects it to other parts of Chennai. It's a small park where you get to see spotted deers, black bucks, hyenas, mongoose, squirrel, Hares, bats, Monkeys, Tortoises, Scorpions, Millipedes, variety of birds etc. Variety of spiders and butterflies, molluscs is seen here.

Name: the_tanmoy
Title: Small Zoo Near Park is awesome!
Review: Small Zoo Near Park is awesome! We visited it on the last day of the trip. It is near the Snake Park. So, you can go to both the places together. There were deers in the open and they were just running across the zoo, when we went in the early morning. It was nice to see. There's a huge paid parking space. Lots of animals and birds - though some big animals like Elephant, Giraffes, Zebras, Lions and Tigers were missing. Good place for the kids to play around as well. They have two small kids playing areas.

Name: Latheesh C
Title: The Best National Zoo Among Others In India
Review: The park has been so nice with¬†variety of animals around and deer to be the prominent. People should not be allowed to bring eatables or plastic covers inside the premises.Do visit there if you are a animal lover too. Do not visit on Tuesday or any National holidays as they are closed those days.

Name: Arun S
Title: Ostrich, Emu, and Falcan birds were the most atracted me
Review: Popularity among children can be assessed by the presence of the crowd of children of less than15 years of age, ‡§ù‡•Ç‡§≤‡•á, See-saw and other playground equipment, variety of birds and wild animals were the main attractions for the children

Name: HassanMalik
Title: Not all that great...
Review: Guindy National Park is located within the city, hence people use it more like a park. During holidays its very crowded, not point visiting.Its very very small..considering its called national park...not much greenery...instead just visit the snake park to see good collection of crocodiles....no much activity of snakes though...as they are sleeping all the time...I would definitely recommend the Arignar zoo over this...its considered the best in the country....

Name: Sunand S
Title: A very good place to spend your half day with kids and family
Review: A well maintained place , easily approachable,  nice zoo and slides for kids . I have seen people coming up with there lunch boxes , eating at park , which is something we all should avoid , all together nice place , very informative for kids

Name: Damian O
Title: Well kept!
Review: Nice place to take the kids. The animals are great and the gardens too. Everything is neat and clean.

Name: vijayalakshmik1982
Title: Good place for kids
Review: Vast campus with a very low entrance fee.A big dinosaur statue welcomes you into the park.  The park has a good set of animal / bird exhibits which keep the kids (age group 3 to 7) interested throughout the visit (lasting for about 3 hours). The park is well maintained.There is also a kids play area.Keep in mind that it involves a lot of walking, so do carry enough water and a cap/ hat along with sunglasses. Avoid visiting during summer as the kids may get tired very soon.

Name: Hemanth_Vamsi
Title: Must visit
Review: Exciting place for children..Just 20‚Çπ ticketItz like a mini zooMany birds crocodiles deers are there Beside this, snakes park also exist For that also 20‚Çπ ticket

Name: Chrysalisworld
Title: Impressed by the cleanliness
Review: It took about an hour and half to see all the attractions at the park. It was INR 20 per adult and INR 20 to use our mobile phone cameras. There were mostly different deer, emus, ostrich, turtles, monkeys, parakeets, etc in cages and a very very small aquarium. A few snakes were also housed at the park. If you wish to see a variety of animals then head to Vandalur Zoo but if you want to do a leisurely stroll with kids (especially after 4.30 pm) then Guindy Park is a perfect option because of all the greenery. I was very impressed by the cleanliness. I was visiting the park after more than 20 years and it was the cleanliness that struck me. Keep up the good work.

Name: khan25kareena
Title: Animals all over the Guindy National Park
Review: Located close to Raj Bhavan,Guindy National Park is an extension to the grounds of the official residence of the governors of Tamil Nadu.This thorn forest is touted to be the smallest national park in India.Despite the size,the park has variety of animals and birds.There is also a small aquarium at the park.

Name: Shashank
Title: Huge
Review: The Park is huge, covering a large part of Guindy, with places located all around it. Different varieties of animals spread all over its area. Can be hard to navigate during the hot sunny season, but nevertheless pleasing during the colder weather.

Name: None I
Title: Average Park, lot of scope for improvement
Review: Guindy National park is located within the busy city limits of Chennai.  It is very well connected by local city buses and train.  It is a small sized park.  Few animals which we spotted there are black bucks, jackals, tortoises, deer and few birds.  There is a separate section dedicated to snakes.  The park is lush green, offers fresh air and a feeling of being amidst nature within the busy city of Chennai.  There are very few food outlets within the park with less options. Also, maintenance is poor. There's lot of scope to improve on maintenance. The park can be cleaner.

Name: shymathans
Title: guindy park
Review: good place just timepass but not much as vandaloor zoo, enjoyed the time with friends. good for kids

Name: Manu B
Title: Average
Review: Quite small, 1 hour is more than enough to explore if you are without kids else 1.5 hrTicket is 20 and for mobile camera 20 more. For professional camera its 100. Off the main road so easily accessible via private or public transport.Few animals inside..

Name: Ramkumar R
Title: Nature in the middle of the city
Review: Guindy National park should be one of the must visit places in Chennai. Just for a calm and relaxed day. Kids would definitely like it more.

Name: venkatindia007
Title: Serene feel
Review: This is the first time being inside this park, though living in Chennai since birth.  Suprised to see such serene place within the chaotic chennai city.  stretches around 7 kms. for a walk through.  Though there were not much animal sightings, the feel inside the park inside gave a pleasing impact to our physique as well as mind.  Felt very much refreshed after the walk for about 2 hours.

Name: Shobhan k
Title: Quick refresher
Review: Located in the heart of the city, it serves as a quick refresher for your mind and eyes with its flora and fauna.can spend about 3 hours in the evening or morning. Afternoons can be bit hot despite the trees due to humidity and Chennai's hot sun.

Name: ClickAwayWithCanon
Title: Best animal park in the city premises. Good spot for a picnic. Kids will enjoy.
Review: Guindy National Park is located in Guindy, Chennai and is the 8th smallest National Park of India and one of the very few national parks situated inside a city. The visiting timings of the park is from 9.00 am to 5.30 pm and is open on all days except Tuesday which is declared as a holiday. The nearest local railway station is the Kasturibai Nagar MRTS station which is less than a kilometer away and 1 km away from Guindy railway station. You can also reach the park by MTC buses and get down at the Cancer Institute stop/IIT stop. The entry fee for adults is Rs 20 and Rs 25 for a still camera. There is also a snake park beside the park for which entry fee is different.

Name: cool1960
Title: Place to relax and enjoy
Review: Car park is available. Located at the centre of the city. Tickets are very cheap. Not too big to go around and not too small. We can spend one to two hours easily. Park, some animals etc are there. Kids , couples and all age people will like it.

Name: helpothers2016
Title: Nice calm place best for children
Review: Good Park in the middle of the city, with lot of busses connecting or even more car parking space. Children will enjoy the place as good garden, some animals are there.

Name: kumarjayamalla
Title: average park
Review: Not a big park and not even many attractions in it compared the others. Only thing is to happy transportation is good from any area.

Name: sujithkizhara
Title: Nice park
Review: In Chennai we  can spend time with guindy park, in this we can see snake park also, we can see different kind of snakes, but snake park is not a big park

Name: manoj k
Title: haven for Bird lover and curious people
Review: Guindy National Park is best to see the rare bird. , Bird of  many species  also species from the all wold. also cute animals can be seen here . vising will special occasion for kids.

Name: Bharatbackpacker
Title: Exalted zoo
Review: I understand having a national park in the center of a sprawling metropolis is difficult, but calling GNP a national park is gross stretch of imagination. It's designed and looks like a zoo. The kids seems to have fun, but, I was pretty disappointed with the dry land (maybe due to my expectation that it would be more like a botanical garden). The animals were so well fenced in that it was difficult to see them even. Two standout exhibits were the aquarium and a cassowary (looks like a cross between a turkey and an emu). I payed 20 Rs for camera but would recommend others. As the animals and birds were fenced you can't get any good photos besides people were using their mobile phones for taking photos without any questions.

Name: NivasKrishna
Title: Awesome place
Review: Kids would love this park very quite park for children in the heart of the city a park would make people happy but it comes with rs 20 ticket

Name: Sanusc
Title: Very average
Review: Its probably considered good because its within city limits.Parking on holidays is a problem, not so well organised.Good green place within the city

Name: moothayil
Title: GUINDY
Review: The Guindy National Park, is the smallest National Park with an area of 2.76 km¬≤ It hosts a variety of endangered deer, foxes, monkeys and snakes.  It is good place to see animal within the city .

Name: Shyamis
Title: Restricted entry, yet a nice place to visit
Review: Not many people know about this place as this has restricted entry. People go to the children's park and snake park and miss out on this. A forest ranger has to accompany you when you go inside this place. Right beside Raj Bhavan/IIT campus.

Name: cool1960
Title: Green Park
Review: A calm place for us to see in the middle of city. Lots of green is seen here and you also find some animals.Nice place to relax a bit as it is in the middle of the city. Easily reachable. As lots of colleges are nearby we find lots of students enjoying and having fun there cutting their classes.

Name: Ghiri T
Title: The smallest protected park of Tamil Nadu
Review: It is the 8th smallest park of India located in Chennai. It is one of the national park situated inside the city. Here we can see large varieties of animals and birds. This park is an extension of Raj Bhavan,the official residence of the Governor of Tamil Nadu.

Name: TravelFreek1994
Title: Wildlife at guindy
Review: Great place to have a picnic lunch with family and friends alike. Good for visiting rare species of animals. Kids will enjoy for sure.

Name: ArunaSrinivas
Title: A mini zoo and play area for kids
Review: If you are a nature and wildlife lover, dont miss this green, quiet hangout hidden in the woods on the Rajbhavan road. Kids would enjoy the company of free roaming deers and the animals. A well-maintained play area is also a plus.

Name: DrKumaresh
Title: Losing its sheen
Review: I remember spending my childhood days during in this place, of late this place seems to be not maintained upto its standards. If properly maintained will be a wonderful place for kids to see the animals.

Name: SibaritainDubai
Title: Terrible conditions !
Review: This park is truly a jail for the animals: is dirty, using extremely small cages n all the animals look in terrible conditions. I was truly disappointed when I visited it. PETA should be informed about it.

Name: kathiranand7
Title: Everyone knows about this park
Review: Guindy national park one of the most famous park in chennai very good and clean nowadays very good to go with family and friends

Name: velu2317
Title: Strictly for Children :)
Review: Peaceful time spending spot in hot of the city :) worth for one half day picnic.. good in winter time :)

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: National park in city
Review: Away  from the bustling crowd in Chennai. Less number of animals as compared to other national parks.

Name: nytikjoshi
Title: Good to go if kids need to see wild life near/in the city
Review: Good place, low on entry tickets, Visit it on a Saturday avoid Sundays and the rush that goes with that day. Try to visit the park in two trips as doing it all on one go can be very tiring. Pack somethings to eat as the options i found there did not look clean/ healthy. The animals looked tired and exhausted from the heat, although i found the zoo keepers busy with their feeding trucks restocking foods in the cages. Given the choice i would not be too happy seeing animals locked up but for the lack of anything better will be forced to go here to show kids/children what wild animals look in their living from as they have not seen anything else other than their pictures in school books. Do visit the animated show for a additional cost of Rs 40 but it is only in Tamil but do check it out for the AC -cooling factor a bit of solace from the scorching Chennai heat.

Name: ramayana2013
Title: a place to enjoy
Review: this is near rajbavan at guindy. this covers a vast area of about 2.70 k m protected area managed by the forest dept.here the snake park is famous. here you can see rare varities of snakes.king cobras, pythans,viper snakes,huge aquarium of sea snakes and turtles.                       nearby is the children park where children can enjoy.flora andfouna are famous here. children like the huge dynosar statue here. deers, monkeys, and crocodiles are also seen here.. about 150 diffrent types of birds here.lot of walking required. dont forget to carry drinking water.

Name: VRAMESH
Title: No animals inside the Park
Review: Guindy National Park, Snake Park and Children park are one and the same. You will see only snakes and little bit of birds inside park. Nothing else.

Name: MOUNTMANAGER
Title: Nice place for children
Review: It is a good park for children. They can spend a full day as you have a large play area and lot of deer left free and close to children

Name: urenig
Title: Good pinic place
Review: If you are in chennai, this is a must visit zoo.As a kid we were taken for day tour every year to this place. Club it with snake park it makes an awesome trip

Name: 8pritesh
Title: Well planned city and park.
Review: The national park is very well planned and organised. Its very beautiful and has lots of wild animals..its also in the heart of city and a very peaceful place

Name: Shyam V
Title: Worth visiting
Review: A Place to visit in Chennai particularly if you are from outside Chennai. Exposes children to a lot of good Things. Combine With Snake park.

Name: D Nitin A
Title: Nice place for kids day out
Review: Very good place to spend the whole place with kids, massive play area for children. Lots of empty space for the families to sit under the trees shade and have lunch. Also relax and have fond memories of the school days.

Name: Mimmy2014
Title: Good for kids
Review: After visiting vandalur zoo, this one is comparatively small and less animals to see.But kids love this place, because of play area and spacious.My kid was happy to be here...he enjoyed running around and talking with animals and birds.

Name: travalingyogi
Title: Nice place for outing with Family
Review: Nice picnic kinds place with kids & family. Not a very big place but nice place for outing with family.

Name: eaglecbe
Title: very nice
Review: i liked the beautiful place and i was enjoyed very well with my family......................................................................

Name: MArasu2000
Title: Don't have Great Expectations
Review: As kids, we grew up with only the Guindy National Park doubling as the Zoo @ Chennai. Later...came the Vandalur Zoo which took most of the animals (mostly wild) from Guindy to Vandalur.Must have been there over 10 times before I was 10 yrs old...atleast 6+ times during my kids growing stages...definitely kicked a lot of nice old memories. Now, Guindy Park is a typical park with very few animal attractions. The entrance is usually crowded...parking just ok - for both Cars and Bikes. To be avoided during long weekends and Pongal times. The park entry looks worrying with a lot of paper and plastic waste lying on the roads..but inside the park, its much better. There used to be checks at the entry to stop plastic covers inside...but did not see that happening these days.We start with a stroll and see about 3 to 4 varieties of Deers (Samba, Antelope etc), 6 to 7 varieties of Snakes with live chickens waiting to be eaten, an open birds areas with about a dozen varieties of cranes, spoonbills etc... 2 to 3 Crocodiles, 2 wild dogs, about 6 Peacocks, Sea Otter, Parrots, Parakeets etc..The star attraction of the evening was the peacocks...the white peacock which was dancing with his feathers fully open and then the other bluish green feathered Peacock too joined the rains oncoming with its rain dance. A large play area for the kids with swings, slides, see-saws attract all the children and parents crowd to this park.With an entry fees of Rs. 5 for the bikes and not sure for cars, Rs. 5 for kids (between 2 to 12 yrs) and Rs. 20 for adults, Rs. 20 for a camera.Guards will force to buy Camera tickets for any cell phone too (since its got a camera),but if you dont wish to take snaps, just be clear that you dont want to take snaps.There are a lot of crowded food stalls at the entrance serving Coffee, tea, sandwich, pizza, tender coconut, ice creams etc..A good idea to spend about 2 to 3 hours strolling and watching the birds, animals and the public in the only known green patch in the middle of Chennai.Having seen many wonderful parks in Washington DC, NYC, Sao Paulo, Brasilia, Taipei, Shanghai, Hangzhou, Bangalore etc...Guindy maynot be impressive...but being a proud Chennaite...this is our local pride...Saving another weekend for a trip to the Vandalur zoo...very soon...Until then...Ciao...

Name: ManuelSMD
Title: Nothing Special
Review: I went there expecting a bit variety of animals and to spend couple hrs, however didn't stay 1h. A bit disappointing the whole park, quite small and very few animals. Good side, at least I only paid 20 rupees

Name: Traveloney
Title: Can be better
Review: All you can find here is more of deers, monkeys and few birds like peacock, peahens and parrots. I remember seeing quite a lot of animals when I was a kid. But its been more than 20 years since then. The park surely requires maintenance and renovation. On the whole it is surely a place for timepass, nothing more than that. There is nothing much in here to be fascinated about.

Name: Sanjay K
Title: Good place to pass time
Review: I went there by lot of Expectations..But disappointed.. As usual like other zoo..Nothing more than birds,and monkey.

Name: writingale
Title: The only city zoo in chennai
Review: Zoo may be a big word, this is a very small zoo / animal park but it's laid out well so you can spend a nice afternoon by yourself or with your family and kids. very cheap entrance fee but it closes by 6pm so you are advised to reach there at least a couple of hours earlier. Located opposite to Anna University and next to IIT entrance.
